pros: I don’t think I’ll ever find a job I like as much as I liked working at Craig. The people are amazing.
cons: Pay, although they do market adjustments to stay competitive

job_title: Rehab Tech I in Englewood, CO
pros: President Jandell Allen-Davis, efforts to increase morale, fantastic insurance package, matching 401K, education reimbursement, more respect, responsibility and autonomy for CNAs than elsewhere, many nurses and supervisors are fantastic, opportunity to work with professionals at the top of their field, many of whom show respect for CNAs.
cons: Pay is way too low ($18) for what is expected of rehab and behavior techs (handling a tremendous amount of stool, violent patients, traumatized families, high stress environment on brain injury floors, techs are expected to have a high level of behavior management ability and training, chart behaviors every 15 minutes for scatterplot data, and much more.) They have good techs who are willing to serve this population but they need to be fairly compensated.

pros: Mission driven with purpose and advancement of the mission you witness everyday. “Patient centered” is actionable and real. People respect each other and there’s a lot of opportunity for career growth if you stay open to new ideas about what career growth means.
cons: The long tenure of some staff can make new people feel like they aren’t valued or trusted.

review_title: Excellent pay, but “sick time” doesn’t exist
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Denver, CO
pros: Pay is by far the best I found for a new grad nurse.
cons: call in policy is strangely punitive, even in comparison to other hospitals in the area.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Englewood, CO
pros: family oriented, great people, caring, loving
cons: Sometimes can be short staff

pros:
- Lots of support for nursing.
- The coolest, most supportive CEO of any hospital, anywhere!
- Rehab environment means that you build relationships and actually see your patients get better.
- Educational interdisciplinary environment.
- Famous, award-winning facility means that you work among the best of the best.
- Evidence-based practice with active research involvement.
cons:
- Understaffed at times, although the hospital is trying to do better.
- Very busy on higher acute floors; can be like mini-ICU. 
- Some long-term patients who are not rehabilitatable; leads to nursing burnout.
- TBI doctors are spread very thin; need to hire for adequate coverage.
- Some less than desirable elements of nursing culture are tolerated without intervention; can be high drama and negative, especially on TBI floor.

job_title: Desktop Support Technician in Denver, CO
pros: Great place to work to give back to the community. Low stress, great work hours. No dress code. Shorts all day
cons:
Pay raises always tied to cost of living. Bonus 100-500 .a year.
IT department too much turn over at desktop positions.

pros: Positive work environment and lots of learning opportunities
cons: Fast paced and high stress

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Centennial, CO
pros: Craig Hospital was an amazing place to work. The patients were friendly as well as the staff. I loved working there.
cons: Very fast paced, but that is nothing new to CNA's and Nurses. There are no cons.

pros: Great benefits, great pay, amazing support
cons: Scheduling and time off has always been a little weird and inflexible.

pros: Watching the success stories firsthand over months of rehab was encouraging and reminded us why we went to work every day. Shift differentials and critical shift bonus pay for low staffed days were decent (both were higher for nurses though). The medical benefits were actually pretty decent. It seemed that for most people they worked with your schedule pretty well, so it was good for going through nursing school. As a CNA, there is no real advancement opportunities. As an RN, there were a few ladders you could climb. The new CEO is good, approachable by any employee, and seems to go out of the way to take care of her employees.
cons: Being a CNA there can be mentally draining. You have to have a real passion to work with the brain injured patients every day otherwise it can become extremely stressful mentally.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Daytona Beach, FL
pros: It is the happiest place on earth!
cons: We see some very sad cases.

pros: Awesome place to work always
cons: None. Craig is the best

pros: Craig Hospital was where I started as new grad on the TBI unit. It was a warm place to work. Most were truly happy with their jobs and working there which made for an overall positive environment. Like a family. They really want you to be good at your job and train and give you the tools to do so. They help pay tuition, they did back then not sure on now, and help pay for things like getting extra certifications and such. You can grow there as a nurse.
cons: It has the usual drama like every hospital. It's small so not as many ways to advance up the ladder like a bigger hospital.

review_title: A gratifying, inspiring and uplifting place to work. The work is very physically demanding. This isn't a job for you if you have a weak stomach. You will find that you'll become very attached to the people you are caring for.
pros: Team work among the different departments, and team meetings ensure everyone is on the same page. Watching the improvement of patients that come in over time is an amazing feeling.
cons: Heavy lifting. It can wear on you emotionally because you become very close with your patients. Having to make sure multiple patients are ready for various appointments can be challenging.  But if your good at multitasking, this would be a great job for you.

job_title: Rehabilitation Tech I in Englewood, CO
pros: The nursing staff (non-administration) is very good to work with and the work is very rewarding.
cons: Zero room for advancement.  Horrible pay.  I started at $11.45 per hr in 2010.  I received a good annual review and they gave me a quarter raise.

pros: I have been working as an RN at Craig Hospital for almost four years. This is by far the best, most rewarding job I have ever had. I look forward to going to work and I feel that the work that I do makes a difference every day. I feel valued, respected and love there. My co workers are some of the coolest people I have ever met. It is a positive, healing environment.
cons: None that I can think of.

job_title: Rehab Tech I in Littleton, CO
pros: I love the atmosphere at Craig.  The culture is very "can do" and positive.  The way Craig deals with the patients, educates families and inserts themselves into people's lives is like no other hospital.  They are compassionate, giving, sympathetic, very skilled and very understanding.  They offer the best in spinal cord and traumatic brain injury rehab in the world!
cons: Shortage of staffing and lower pay for some positions

review_title: It was a rewarding and challenging work environment, staffed with very positive and passionate people.
job_title: Rehab Tech I in Englewood, CO
pros: The atmosphere was hopeful and positive. It promotes personal growth, encourages team work, and provides plenty of opportunities to develop leadership skills.
cons: It is a high stress job. You work with people who at are at their worst, and many patients may not make full recoveries. Monetary compensation for lower level positions is low compared to the level of stress at work.

job_title: Certified Nurse Aid in Englewood, CO
pros: Most of the employees at Craig really care about the patients and helping them to achieve their best possible outcome.
cons: For the amount of, and level of difficulty of work they do CNA's are not paid enough.  The benefits are great however so that is taken into consideration.

job_title: Physical Therapist Aide in Englewood, CO
pros: Craig Hospital is an incredible employer! Staff and patients are caring and friendly. Positive and supportive work environment! Highly recommended!
cons: Can be emotional challenging and draining at times. Physically exhausting and often times challenging. Food in the cafeteria is on most days decent but I preferred to bring my own lunch.

pros: Great organization to work for. Lot's of flexibility, caring and supportive teammates and environment.
cons: There is limited upward mobility. Communication could also be improved, particularly to new employees that want opportunities to work harder and get more involved.

review_title: Great place to stay for a while!
pros: For once you truly feel like you're making a difference.  Tuition reimbursement.  Great coworkers.  Different shift times available.  Great pay compared to my previous jobs.
cons: The usual workplace drama.  Small, small, small discount on food.

pros: Working at Craig is like being with your family, extended family. Positive work culture, lots of tenure here, great benefits!
cons: Could use more diversity in the workforce, in all areas. They are starting to work towards that.

review_title: Feel very blessed to work at Craig Hospital - We do excellent work
pros: Great work, great people, great patients.  Although hard work - very rewarding!
cons: Not a lot of room for promotion

pros: We are all a great big family. We work closely with one another and all care about our job and each other
cons: Understaffed a lot of times makes for a very busy shift.

pros: Lots of support. Learning opportunities, chance to make a difference
cons: Sometimes short staffed, very busy.

pros: Great staff, wonderful vision, the patient to nurse ratio is excellent , work schedule is great
cons: On the low end of pay

pros: Great Life Experience, you will grow more as a person
cons: Pay is horrible and hours are long.

pros: it is great place to work
cons: none i was happy working there

pros: Best place I have ever worked.
cons: Not much room for movement.

pros: the staff are very hard working and care about the patients
cons: little to not continuing education offered, many recent chages

pros: work go with school, close to home.
cons: poor management, to many inexperience people in leadership roles.
